title: Solasta 2 Brings More 5E Goodness And Baldur's Gate 3 Star To PC In 2025
description: Solasta: Crown of the Magister is a fantastic video-game translation of D&D's 5E ruleset, doing so with a healthy dose of humor and charm years before Baldur's Gate 3. Now, developer Tactical Adventures is hard at work on a full sequel, Solasta 2, and PC players will be able to take it for a spin in 2025.Announced during The Game Awards 2024 and launching initially in early access on PC, Solasta 2 will see players battle an "all-powerful being" named Shadwyn, who is voiced by Baldur's Gate 3 narrator Amelia Tyler. The game is set on the new continent of Neokos, which creative director Mathieu Girard said is filled with "unprecedented lore." If you've played Baldur's Gate 3, you should be very familiar with most of the turn-based mechanics coming to Solasta 2. It makes use of the "full depth" of the 5E system, according to the developer, which--much like the first game--means playing it can actually give you a very good crash course in learning D&D, even though it's not set in any Wizards of the Coast universe.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Overwatch 2 Debuts Avatar Collaboration Costumes And A Free Skin
description: Earlier this year, Overwatch 2 only gave a handful of characters new costumes for the Transformers crossover collaboration. But after teasing the Avatar: The Last Airbender collaboration earlier this month, Blizzard has revealed that six Overwatch 2 heroes are getting in on the act this time.Six of the Overwatch 2 heroes get their Avatar makeovers.Via Overwatch's official site, these are the heroes who will have Avatar-inspired costumes.Mei as KataraZenyatta as AangOrisa as AppaVenture as TophGenji as ZukoKiriko as SukiBlizzard invited players to get the "gaang" back together with a pun inspired by the lead character from The Last Airbender. The publisher also dropped a new animated trailer that blends the best of both worlds in a playful match with each other.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Mafia: The Old Country release date shrinks to summer 2025
description: Open world fuhgeddaboudit simulator Mafia: The Old Country will release in summer 2025, according to a Youtube trailer that has leaked on social media ahead of tonight's Game Awards. The trailer also treats us to a few snippets of the game's story scenes, shoot-outs and punch-ups. We get to see wise guys swinging knives, riding horses and glowering silently at sun-baked Sicilian countryside. Read more
author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell

title: Come join us for our Game Awards 2024 liveblog
description: Tonight is The Game Awards 2024, the first since Geoff Keighley killed E3 and consumed its heart in front of a group of screaming schoolchildren. Just saying, this had better be good, Geoff, especially after the 2023 show‚Äôs "embarrassing" shooing-off of developers whose acceptance speeches cut into that valuable trailer showcase time. Who will need to please wrap it up this time? Which games will be revealed? Will there be a musical number to top last year‚Äôs Herald of Darkness performance? (That was fun, actually, fair play on that one.) You can find out right along with us, as we once again fire up the RPS liveblog-o-tron to report all the developments as they happen. Even the ones that happen at 3:45am, when I‚Äôll be desperately trying not to collapse into my keyboard like a felled tree. Read more
author: James Archer

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 860
description: So‚Ä¶what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn‚Äôt, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It‚Äôs just a list of more or less random questions I‚Äôve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Where would you rather go on vacation: New Zealand, Alaska, Costa Rica or Switzerland? I‚Äôd love to go to all of these places, but right now Switzerland sounds pretty cool. 2. Ponytail or curls? Hmm. I like ponytails because they‚Äôre functional, but sometimes they give me a headache, so let‚Äôs go with curls. They‚Äôd have to be super loose ones, though. And kinda messy! 3. Did you ever have a job where you had to wear a uniform? Kinda. We had very specific guidelines for safety when I worked at the bakery, like close-toed shoes, no nail polish, hair tied back. 4. If you were in school, whom would you likely hang out with: the athletes, the drama crew, the band kids or the honors society? You‚Äôd[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 860 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.

title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 841
description: Seasons greetings! Hard to believe we‚Äôre in full-on Christmas season time now, isn‚Äôt it? Folks getting their tree (we did today!), putting up the Christmas lights (workin‚Äô on it!), other decorations. I was looking back at December posts over the years, and when I came upon this one it made me smile. üôÇ Mt. Saint Tabby? That was SO Tabs. It was a quiet morning on our hill today. Nothing really exciting happened, except for some joggers running by, which made a certain someone‚Äôs tail poof up‚Ä¶ While Tabs checked out the usual blades of grass, plants and trees, I spent some time thinking about how possessive and jealous Tabs gets now in his older age. And not just with his humans. He‚Äôs also like that with his domain outside. I may or may not have received a Post-It last week asking me to write the city about renaming our hill, ‚ÄúMt. Saint Tabby,‚Äù because Tabs doesn‚Äôt like the thought of anybody, and by ‚Äúanybody,‚Äù I mean any other cats, chilling on his hill.
